src.repository.contacts module

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactCreate, owner_id: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → Contact[source]

Creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – The data for the new contact.

  • db – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact object.

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str, owner_id: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → Contact | None[source]

Retrieves a single contact by its email address.

Parameters:

  • email – The email of the contact to retrieve.

  • db – The database session.

Returns:

The contact object, or None if not found.

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, owner_id: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → Contact | None[source]

Retrieves a single contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db – The database session.

Returns:

The contact object, or None if not found.

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, owner_id: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → List[Contact][source]

Retrieves a list of contacts with pagination.

Parameters:

  • skip – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contact objects.

async src.repository.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(owner_id: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → List[Contact][source]

Retrieves contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

db – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, owner_id: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → Contact | None[source]

Removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • db – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact object, or None if not found.

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, owner_id: int, skip: int, limit: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → List[Contact][source]

Searches for contacts by a query string in first name, last name, or email.

Parameters:

  • query – The search query string.

  • skip – The number of contacts to skip for pagination.

  • limit – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db – The database session.

Returns:

A list of found contact objects.

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, owner_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → Contact | None[source]

Updates an existing contact’s information. Only updates the fields provided in the body.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body – The data to update the contact with.

  • db – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact object, or None if not found.

src.repository.users module

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserCreate, password_hash: str, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → User[source]

Creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (UserCreate) – The user’s registration data.

  • password_hash (str) – The pre-hashed password.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The created user object.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → User | None[source]

Retrieves a user by their email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The user object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

Optional[User]

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_id(user_id: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession, redis: redis.asyncio.Redis) → User | None[source]

Retrieves a user by their ID, with Redis caching.

First checks the Redis cache, and if the user is not found, fetches them from the database and stores the result in Redis.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • redis (Redis) – The Redis client instance.

Returns:

The user object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

Optional[User]

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(user: User, avatar_url: str, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → User[source]

Updates the avatar URL for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose avatar needs to be updated.

  • avatar_url (str) – The new URL for the user’s avatar.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_refresh_token(user: User, refresh_token: str, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → None[source]

Updates the refresh token for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose refresh token needs to be updated.

  • refresh_token (str) – The new refresh token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

async src.repository.users.verify_user(user: User, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) → User[source]

Marks a user’s account as verified.

This function is typically called after a user confirms their email address.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object to be verified.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The verified user object.

Return type:

User

Raises:

SQLAlchemyError – If a database operation fails.
